Class Tower

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tower

  • public class Tower
extends java.lang.Object
    Tower class will hold two integers to indicate its position on the board. It will also hold an ArrayList of pieces to show which pieces are currently in the tower. There can be a maximum of 3 pieces per Tower and a minimum of 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tower

        public Tower(int r,
             int c)
        Constructor for Tower. Takes in two integers to determine its position on the board. Tower will not move around the board, only pieces will. Pieces will move from one tower to the next.
        Parameters:
        r - row number
        c - column number

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Piece p)
        add function takes in a piece and adds it to the Tower's ArrayList. It will be used to take in sub class pieces and add it to the tower. This allows the towers to "stack" pieces. The top most piece is the only one able to move in the tower and the tower's height determines its moveset and attack range.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to be added to the tower

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        returns column number of the tower
        Returns:
        col

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        returns row number of the tower
        Returns:
        row

      • remove

        public Piece remove(int piece)
        Removes a certain piece from the tower's ArrayList. Return the piece, so it can be added to its new destination. Then there will be no need to create and delete pieces.
        Parameters:
        piece - position of piece in tower(0-2)
        Returns:
        the removed piece

      • removeTop

        public Piece removeTop()
        Removes the top piece from the tower and returns it
        Returns:
        top piece

      • addToTower

        public void addToTower(Tower T)
        Takes the top piece from this tower and adds it to the top of the indicated tower
        Parameters:
        T - target tower

      • getTowerID

        public java.lang.String getTowerID()
        Function will return a string that represents the pieces in the tower. Used in displaying the board's current condition.
        Returns:
        String representation of the tower's pieces

      • checkPawn

        public java.lang.Boolean checkPawn()
        Checks if there's a pawn in this tower
        Returns:
        true/false
